newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Brussels names intermediaries for small caps mkt.
newsitem.headline: Brussels names intermediaries for small caps mkt.

text.p: The Brussels bourse on Wednesday named nine intermediaries who planned to participate in its "Nouveau Marche" for small and medium sized firms, which it said was still on target to be launched at the start of 1997.

The Nouveau Marche is part of the Euro-NM project involving the Paris, Frankfurt and Brussels bourses. Paris set up its Nouveau Marche in February this year, and the German counterpart is also due for launch in 1997.
"The interest shown by financial intermediaries is clear. Nine have already expressed their intention to participate as (both) sponsors and market makers," a bourse statement said.

The nine were Banque Bruxelles Lambert SA ; Banque Paribas Belgique SA; Degroof Securities SA; Dewaay, Servais & Cie SA; Generale de Banque SA ; KB-Securities NV; Petercam SA; Puilaetco; Smeets Verbaet & Co, NV.
"We are waiting for foreign financial intermediaries to join the group of Belgian ones in the weeks ahead," the bourse added.
Brussels bourse official Robert Thys told Reuters that several Belgian companies had already unofficially declared an interest in being quoted on the Brussels Nouveau Marche.
